original_sap_section_used.ends_at: 10.3. Vital Signs, Weight and Body Surface Area

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical laboratory assessments include hematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis, and coagulation.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical laboratory tests: hematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both documents list the same four main categories.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory. Reported units and normal ranges are various among sites.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory samples will be collected according to the Schedule of Assessments (Section 11.1).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical laboratory tests... will be performed within 3 days prior to Day 1 of each cycle.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory. Reported units and normal ranges are various among sites. Reported units will be converted to standard units, if applicable.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory for routine monitoring; however, data will be standardized to International System (SI) units for reporting and analysis.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both specify local lab analysis and standardization of units.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including... hematology... will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Hematology: Hematocrit, hemoglobin, white blood cell count, absolute neutrophil count (ANC), and platelets.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Hematology: hematocrit, hemoglobin, white blood cell count, absolute neutrophil count and platelets
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP lists specific parameters matching the Protocol. Original SAP implies them via 'all numeric laboratory parameters' and Appendix 14.2.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry... will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical Chemistry: Albumin, alkaline phosphatase (ALP), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), blood urea nitrogen (BUN), calcium, chloride, creatine phosphokinase (CPK), creatine kinase-myocardial band (CK-MB) isoenzyme, total cholesterol, creatinine, creatinine clearance (CrCl) (estimated by Cockcroft-Gault formula, see Section 11.6), gamma-glutamyl transferase (GGT), glucose, lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), triglyceride, high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, phosphate, potassium, sodium, total bilirubin, direct bilirubin, total protein, and uric acid.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical chemistry: albumin, alkaline phosphatase, alanine aminotransferase, aspartate aminotransferase, blood urea nitrogen, calcium, chloride, creatine phosphokinase, creatine kinase-myocardial band isoenzyme, total cholesterol, creatinine, CrCl..., gamma-glutamyl transferase, glucose, lactate dehydrogenase, triglyceride, high-density lipoprotein cholesterol, phosphate, potassium, sodium, total bilirubin, direct bilirubin, total protein, uric acid
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP lists specific parameters matching the Protocol. Original SAP implies them via 'all numeric laboratory parameters'.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including... numeric urinalysis... will be summarized... The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters including microscopic urinalysis... will be categorized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Urinalysis: Bilirubin, blood, glucose, ketones, leukocytes, nitrite, pH, protein, specific gravity, and urobilinogen via dipstick.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Urinalysis: bilirubin, blood, glucose, ketones, leukocytes (white blood cells), nitrite, pH, protein, specific gravity, urobilinogen and microscopic examination
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP lists specific parameters matching the Protocol.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters including microscopic urinalysis... 24 hours urine collection (protein)
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Microscopic examination and 24-hour urine collection (for protein) will be performed if indicated.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: microscopic examination... 24 hour urine collection if indicated at Screening
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches Original SAP and Protocol requirements.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including... coagulation will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Coagulation: Prothrombin time (PT) and prothrombin time international normalized ratio (INR) (for patients receiving aspirin).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Coagulation: ... prothrombin time and prothrombin time international normalized ratio tests
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP lists specific parameters matching the Protocol.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The baseline value for all analyses will be the last non-missing value prior to the first infusion unless otherwise specified.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Baseline is defined in Section 4.2.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline... will be summarized... by... visit... If visit names are ‘Unscheduled’ or ‘EOT’, the post-baseline result of laboratory data will be presented by period
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Post-baseline summaries will include all scheduled visits during the Induction Study Period (Cycles 1 through 6), Maintenance Study Period (Cycles 1 and every 3 cycles thereafter), and the End of Treatment (EOT) visit.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical chemistry, hematology, urinalysis and coagulation data will be presented in separate listings
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: All laboratory data will be included in the data listings.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology... will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Summaries of actual values and change from baseline will be provided for hematology and clinical chemistry.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including... numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized using descriptive statistics... The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters... will be summarized in a shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Coagulation and urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only.
evaluation_table.omitted_content: Requirement to summarize numeric urinalysis and coagulation, and shift tables for non-numeric urinalysis.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP explicitly requires summaries for numeric urinalysis and coagulation, and shift tables for non-numeric urinalysis. Generated SAP explicitly restricts these to listings only.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline... will be summarized using descriptive statistics by treatment group, laboratory category, test parameter and visit.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory parameters will be summarized by treatment group and visit using descriptive statistics.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline... will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Summaries will include both actual values and change from baseline values.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table. [Implies by-visit summaries use scheduled]
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: As established in Section 4.5, nominal visits will be used for these summaries. Only scheduled visits will be included in by-visit summaries.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Standard practice consistent with Original SAP implication.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: according to CTCAE version 5.0.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory abnormalities will be graded according to the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 5.0, where applicable.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: according to the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v.5.0.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: A shift table will be also produced... The number and percentage of patients with a result for each grade will be summarized... Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Shift tables will be used to summarize the number and percentage of patients by baseline category (Grade 0 through 4) versus the worst post-baseline category.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Worst post-baseline value is defined as the most extreme CTCAE grade observed during the Whole Study Period (as defined in Section 4.2), including results from unscheduled assessments.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Reported parameters with units that cannot be converted to standard units will be summarized separately using the original units.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: For parameters not covered by CTCAE grading, shift tables will cross-classify patients by baseline category (Low, Normal, High) relative to the laboratory reference range versus the worst post-baseline category.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP adds specific methodology for non-CTCAE parameters (Low/Normal/High shift) which is a standard safety analysis addition and does not contradict Original SAP.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: null
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Analyses will be performed separately for the "High" and "Low" directions when both are clinically relevant (e.g., potassium).
evaluation_table.reasoning: Standard safety analysis detail added by Generated SAP.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The number and percentage of patients with a result for each grade will be summarized by laboratory category, CTCAE term, visit and CTCAE grade.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The number and percentage of patients with treatment-emergent laboratory abnormalities (defined as an increase in CTCAE grade from baseline) will be summarized by treatment group.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP adds a specific summary for 'treatment-emergent' (increase in grade), which complements the by-grade summary.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: null
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Particular focus will be placed on Grade 3 or 4 abnormalities.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Unscheduled laboratory assessments will be excluded from by-visit summaries but will be included in the determination of the worst post-baseline values and in all listings.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: null
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: If multiple laboratory values are collected on the same study day, the value collected closest to the scheduled assessment time will be used for by-visit summaries.

evaluation_table.component: Multiple values on same day (worst case)
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: For the determination of the worst post-baseline value, the most extreme value among all results (scheduled or unscheduled) for that day will be used.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: A shift table will be also produced by the Whole Study Period and each study period.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Original SAP requires shift tables for each study period (Induction, Maintenance, Follow-up) in addition to Whole Study Period. Generated SAP implies only Whole Study Period shift tables.
missing_from_generated_sap.reasoning: Generated SAP defines worst post-baseline as 'observed during the Whole Study Period', omitting the per-period requirement.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If visit names are ‘Unscheduled’ or ‘EOT’, the post-baseline result of laboratory data will be presented by period, defined as follows... [Detailed logic for assigning EOT/Unscheduled to Induction/Maintenance/Follow-up periods based on infusion dates]
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Original SAP provides specific logic for assigning unscheduled/EOT data to study periods. Generated SAP omits this logic.
missing_from_generated_sap.reasoning: Generated SAP simplifies period summaries to 'scheduled visits' and omits the logic for assigning other data to periods.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: The CTCAE Grade 5 (Death) will not be applied in this analysis since death cannot be determined from a laboratory result.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Rule to exclude Grade 5 from lab analysis.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Grades that require clinical input only will not be assigned to these parameters. Grades which are part numeric and part clinical input will be assigned based on the numeric portion only.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Rule to exclude grades requiring clinical input.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If the post-baseline result for a patient does not satisfy any CTCAE grade, it will be classified as ‘No grade’.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Classification rule for results not meeting CTCAE criteria.

issues.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized using descriptive statistics... The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters including microscopic urinalysis collected as qualitative format will be categorized into normal and abnormal... and will be summarized in a shift table.
issues.generated_sap_text: Coagulation and urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only.
issues.why_they_conflict: Original SAP explicitly requires summary statistics for numeric urinalysis and coagulation, and shift tables for non-numeric urinalysis. Generated SAP explicitly restricts these to listings only.
issues.description: Generated SAP removes required summaries for coagulation and urinalysis.
issues.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP mandates summaries for these parameters. 2) Generated SAP mandates 'listings only'. 3) These are mutually exclusive instructions. 4) This reduces the scope of safety reporting.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: The CTCAE Grade 5 (Death) will not be applied in this analysis since death cannot be determined from a laboratory result.
reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP is silent on this exclusion.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: Grades that require clinical input only will not be assigned to these parameters.
reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP is silent on this exclusion.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized
reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP restricts Coagulation and Urinalysis to listings only.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters... will be summarized in a shift table.
reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP restricts Urinalysis to listings only.

reverse_check.original_sap_statement: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.

extra_information_flagged.content: Low/Normal/High shift tables for non-CTCAE parameters
extra_information_flagged.generated_sap_text: For parameters not covered by CTCAE grading, shift tables will cross-classify patients by baseline category (Low, Normal, High) relative to the laboratory reference range versus the worst post-baseline category.
extra_information_flagged.reasoning: Original SAP does not explicitly forbid this; it enhances reporting for non-graded parameters.

reasoning: The Generated SAP is generally accurate regarding hematology and chemistry parameters and analysis methods (descriptive stats, shift tables, worst post-baseline logic). However, it explicitly contradicts the Original SAP regarding Coagulation and Urinalysis. The Original SAP requires summaries for numeric parameters and shift tables for non-numeric urinalysis, while the Generated SAP restricts these to 'listings only'. This is a reduction in safety reporting scope. Additionally, the Generated SAP omits the detailed logic for assigning unscheduled/EOT data to specific study periods (Induction vs Maintenance) and omits specific CTCAE grading rules (excluding Grade 5 and clinical input grades). These omissions are minor, but the contradiction regarding coagulation/urinalysis summaries is a clear deviation.
summary: The Generated SAP accurately captures the main hematology and chemistry analysis methods but contradicts the Original SAP by restricting coagulation and urinalysis to listings only, whereas the Original SAP requires summaries. It also omits detailed logic for assigning data to study periods and specific CTCAE grading rules.
